channel.title: Kotaku
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site.

item.title: Angela Hill, an MMA fighter I interviewed about cosplay and video games, returns to the UFC this wee
item.description:
Angela Hill, an MMA fighter I interviewed about cosplay and video games, returns to the UFC this weekend. While the UFC’s weigh-in dress code doesn’t allow for as elaborate of cosplay as Invicta, Hill made up for it by doing a great impersonation of Street Fighter’s Sagat.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Nathan Grayson

item.title: Pirates Pounce On Conan Exiles After Developers Accidentally Remove DRM
item.description:
In the never-ending battle between pirates and DRM makers, there are no easy victories. Or at least, that was the case with notorious anti-tamper tech Denuvo until, well, yesterday.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Nathan Grayson on Steamed, shared by Nathan Grayson to Kotaku

item.title: What It’s Like To Be An Iranian Game Developer In Trump’s America
item.description:
Navid Khonsari has been a legal resident of the United States for 17 years. He’s worked on games like Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas, Resident Evil 7, and an interactive story about the Iranian Revolution called 1979 Revolution: Black Friday. These days, though, he doesn’t feel entirely welcome in the US or Iran, and…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Nathan Grayson

item.title: A Look at How Batman Has Totally Taken Over One Batfan’s Life
item.description:
Before you start to worry, the subject of the Being Batman short film clearly states he knows the difference between reality and fiction. Still, this ultra-dedicated Batfan says he’s “out there every night” catching criminals.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Evan Narcisse on io9, shared by Riley MacLeod to Kotaku

item.title: Today's Best Deals: External Storage, Waste King, Sony Bluetooth Headphones, and More
item.description:
An ultra-powerful garbage disposal, 4TB hard drive, and wireless headphones lead off Friday’s best deals from around the web.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shep McAllister on Deals, shared by Shep McAllister to Kotaku

item.title: Scum’s Wish Is A Disturbing Anime About Lovers Who Love Other People
item.description:
In media, teenagers often possess a delicate balance of callousness and narcissism. In CW dramas like Gossip Girl, producers lean into their more sociopathic tendencies, not considering the emotional debates that lead them to cheat, steal or hurt others, all well-trod stereotypes of teenagers discovering themselves.…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Cecilia D'Anastasio

item.title: The Book That Inspired The Witcher Games Is Just $3 on Kindle Today
item.description:
It’s not unusual to see terrible spin-off novels based on hit video game series, but The Witcher is actually a hit video game series spun off of a fantastic series of novels. The first chapter in the series, The Last Wish, is only $3 on Kindle today. Even if you haven’t played the games, it’s a great introduction to…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shep McAllister on Deals, shared by Shep McAllister to Kotaku

item.title: What Are You Playing This Weekend?
item.description:
Do you even have to ask?

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Riley MacLeod

item.title: The third Pokémon Sun and Moon Global Mission reached its goal today.
item.description:
The third Pokémon Sun and Moon Global Mission reached its goal today. Players successfully completed one million trades, and are now heading to the second milestone of two million trades. Good luck!

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Gita Jackson

item.title: What's The Best D&D Character You’ve Ever Made?
item.description:
Rare are the opportunities for Dungeons & Dragons fans to geek out about their favorite character. It’s like explaining your dream to someone. A few seconds in, your poor non-D&D-playing friend’s eyes glaze over in a bored daze.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Cecilia D'Anastasio

item.title: Here's How Fast Cars Would Be If They Advanced At The Pace Of Computers
item.description:
The idea of comparing the pace of development of computers to cars has been around a while. Snopes traces the idea all the way back to some early-internet joke in 1997, even. Fundamentally, it’s sort of an absurd comparison—the two technologies are so different, they’re really not comparable. I did it anyway.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jason Torchinsky on Jalopnik, shared by Riley MacLeod to Kotaku

item.title: Simpler Video Game Menus Are Better
item.description:
The release of the former Wii U exclusive Yoshi’s Woolly World to the Nintendo 3DS demonstrates once again that gaming menus are best when they’re lists. Nothing fancier is needed. We don’t need to be able to wander every which way through them.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Stephen Totilo

item.title: Replay Red Dead Revolver On Your PS4 For $10
item.description:
You could sit quietly in a chair, staring at a wall until the moment Red Dead Redemption 2 comes out, or you could pass the time by replaying the original Red Dead Revolver, available on PS4 for $10.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shep McAllister on Deals, shared by Shep McAllister to Kotaku

item.title: Watching Someone Else Play Resident Evil 7 On YouTube: The Kotaku Review
item.description:
Despite having a taste for horror movies and novels, horror video games freak me the hell out. Still, I was curious about Resident Evil 7's promise of a Southern Gothic zombie game. Like millions of other scaredy cats out there, I decided to watch it on YouTube instead of playing it.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Gita Jackson

item.title: Someone's Gotta Design All Those Game Logos
item.description:
Omer Younas is a veteran games artist who specializes in 2D stuff like logo design and menus. He’s worked on games like Battlefield 1, Metal Gear Solid V and the Crysis series.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Luke Plunkett

item.title: Can Grieving Mothers Stop The Public From Forgetting The NFL's Brain-Trauma Crisis?
item.description:
On Monday afternoon, a group of mothers and other family members of men who have died with chronic traumatic encephalopathy gathered in a room at a hotel in Houston to hold a press conference announcing CTE Awareness Day and promoting their group’s eponymous website, Faces of CTE.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Lindsey Adler on Deadspin, shared by Riley MacLeod to Kotaku

item.title: 'We Are All Scared For Our Jobs': GameStop Employees Share Their Circle Of Life Stories
item.description:
GameStop employees have always been pushy, but an aggressive new policy at the video game retail chain is taking their forcefulness to a new level. And some GameStop staff say it’s making them feel like they have to lie to customers or lose their jobs.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Jason Schreier

item.title: Oculus' John Carmack Has Serious Doubts About $500 Million Lawsuit’s Expert Witness [UPDATE]
item.description:
Oculus CTO and renowned Quake and Doom programmer John Carmack slammed a Dallas jury’s Wednesday decision against Oculus in a $500 million copyright and non-disclosure agreement lawsuit. On Facebook, Carmack specifically takes issue with an expert witness whose testimony, he says, is “just not true.”

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Cecilia D'Anastasio

item.title: When Pin-Ups Meet Harry Potter Cosplay
item.description:
Kotaku cosplay regular Ginny Di returns here with a super cool tribute to Gil Elvgren’s iconic pin-up art, giving the 20th century illustrations a Harry Potter twist.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Luke Plunkett on Cosplay, shared by Riley MacLeod to Kotaku

item.title: American Truck Simulator’s next map expansion will feature New Mexico, SCS announced yesterday.
item.description:
American Truck Simulator’s next map expansion will feature New Mexico, SCS announced yesterday. The roads draw ever closer to my house. Excellent.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Riley MacLeod

item.title: Cut The Cord With Your Choice of Bluetooth Headphone Deals
item.description:
It’s pretty clear by now that wired headphones are a thing of the past for all but the most serious audiophiles. Luckily, Bluetooth headphones are ubiquitous and affordable, and we’ve spotted three different deals today, including on a pair from Sony.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Shep McAllister on Deals, shared by Shep McAllister to Kotaku

item.title: Deadspin Lawsuit: Text Messages Show How Baylor Coaches Turned Football Program Into Disciplinary “B
item.description:
Deadspin Lawsuit: Text Messages Show How Baylor Coaches Turned Football Program Into Disciplinary “Black Hole” | Jezebel Nordstrom Will No Longer Sell Ivanka Trump’s Clothing Line | Sploid Why Are the Windows on the Boeing 787 Dreamliner So Much Bigger Than Normal Airplanes? | The Root Uber CEO Leaves Trump Advisory…

item.dc:creator: Kinja! on Kinja Roundup, shared by Riley MacLeod to Kotaku

item.title: Fire Emblem Heroes Fans Are Deleting And Reinstalling The Game For Better Characters
item.description:
Fire Emblem Heroes, Nintendo’s free mobile strategy game, released yesterday afternoon in the U.S. Instead of actually playing the game, many are finding themselves repeating the opening sections over and over again, in the hopes of cheating the system a little.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Patricia Hernandez

item.title: SecretLab Titan Review: A Big Gaming Chair For Big Gaming People
item.description:
Standard office and gaming chairs are not built for big and tall people. They cower before our broad frames, shudder beneath our weight and generally fear us. The SecretLab Titan, built for the larger-than-guy-sized gamer, has no fear.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Mike Fahey

item.title: Store 4TB of Files (or PS4 Games!) For $110, No Power Cord Required
item.description:
Update: The WD is sold out, but this Wirecutter-recommended Seagate Backup Plus 4TB is available for the same price.
